page.title: The Light at the End of the Tunnel Is a Train

revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Album | | Name = The Light at the End of the Tunnel Is a Train | Type = Studio | Artist = [[Whitey (musician)|Whitey]] | Cover = The Light at the End of the Tunnel is a Train album cover.jpg | Released = 21 March 2005 | Genre = [[Independent music|Indie]], [[Electronic music|electronic]] | Producer = [[Whitey (musician)|Whitey]] | Label = 1234 (UK)
Dim Mak (US) Reviews = * ''[[The Observer]]'' {{Rating|4|5}} [http://observer.guardian.co.uk/omm/10bestcds/story/0,12102,1416646,00.html link]}} '''''The Light at the End of the Tunnel Is a Train''''' is UK indie-electro act [[Whitey (musician)|Whitey]]'s debut studio album. It features the singles "Leave Them All Behind" and "Non Stop". The album was released in the UK on March 21, 2005. ==Track listing== #"Intro/In the Limelight" #"Leave Them All Behind" #"Y.U.H.2.B.M.2" #"A Walk in the Dark/Reprise" #"Can't Go Out, Can't Stay In" #"Tantrum" #"Ha Ha Ha" #"Halfway Gone" #"Non Stop" #"The Light at the End of the Tunnel Is a Train" {{DEFAULTSORT:Light at the End of the Tunnel is a Train}} [[Category:Debut albums]] [[Category:2005 albums]]
